borough: London Borough of Barking and Dagenham
decision_conditions: <p><span style="font-size:11pt">The raised patio for reasons of design, size and scale appears disproportionately large and out of place at this location. Likewise,&nbsp;raised patio's are not a common form of development on Westrow Drive and within the surrounding area. The proposal is therefore considered an uncharacteristic and unsympathetic addition to the dwellinghouse detrimental to the character and appearance of the&nbsp;house, built form of the terrace and character of the area. As such, the proposed development is contrary to: -</span></p><ul><li style="text-align: justify;"><span style="font-size:11pt">National Planning Policy Framework (MHCLG, February 2019); - </span></li><li style="text-align: justify;"><span style="font-size:11pt">Policies 7.1, 7.4, 7.5 and 7.6 of The London Plan (March 2016); - </span></li><li style="text-align: justify;"><span style="font-size:11pt">Policy D4 of the Draft London Plan Intended to Publish (December 2019); - </span></li><li style="text-align: justify;"><span style="font-size:11pt">Policy CP3 of the LDF Core Strategy (July 2010); - </span></li><li style="text-align: justify;"><span style="font-size:11pt">Policy BP11 of the LDF Borough Wide Development Plan Policies DPD (March 2011); - </span></li><li style="text-align: justify;"><span style="font-size:11pt">The Residential Extensions and Alterations Supplementary Planning Document (February 2012); - </span></li><li style="text-align: justify;"><span style="font-size:11pt">Policies SP2, SP4, DMD1 and DMD6 of the Draft Local Plan (Regulation 19&nbsp;Consultation version, October 2020).</span></li></ul><p><br></p>

<p style="text-align:justify"><span style="font-size:11pt">The excessive height of the raised platform, would allow overlooking into the ground floor rear windows and garden's of both neighbouring properties No 96 and 100 Westrow Drive, therefore leading to a significant loss of privacy</span><span style="font-size:11pt">. The proposal therefore constitutes unneighbourly development&nbsp;contrary to: -</span><br></p><ul><li style="text-align: justify;"><span style="font-size:11pt">National Planning Policy Framework (MHCLG, February 2019); -</span></li><li style="text-align: justify;"><span style="font-size:11pt">Policies 7.1, 7.4 and 7.6 of The London Plan (March 2016); - </span></li><li style="text-align: justify;"><span style="font-size:11pt">Policy D4 of the Draft London Plan Intended to Publish (December 2019); - </span></li><li style="text-align: justify;"><span style="font-size:11pt">Policy CP3 of the LDF Core Strategy (July 2010); - </span></li><li style="text-align: justify;"><span style="font-size:11pt">Policies BP8 of the LDF Borough Wide Development Plan Policies DPD (March 2011); - </span></li><li style="text-align: justify;"><span style="font-size:11pt">The Residential Extensions and Alterations Supplementary Planning Document (February 2012); - </span></li><li style="text-align: justify;"><span style="font-size:11pt">Policies DMD1, DMD6, SP2 and SP4 of the Draft Local Plan (Regulation 19&nbsp;Consultation version, October 2020).</span></li></ul>
description: Retrospective application for rear Patio slab up to 3m.
